rootnode.question: We can pass Data between Activities in Android using-
What is ANR in android?
rootnode.option1: Dialog box is called as ANR
rootnode.hint:
ANR stands for Application Not Responding.

An ANR will occur if you are running a process on the UI thread which takes a long time, usually around 5 seconds. During this time the GUI (Graphical User Interface) will lock up which will result in anything the user presses will not be actioned. After the 5 seconds approx has occurred, if the thread still hasn't recovered then an ANR dialogue box is shown informing the user that the application is not responding and will give the user the choice to either wait, in the hope that the app will eventually recover, or to force close the app.

rootnode.question: What is ANR responding time in android?
rootnode.hint: ANR responding time is 5 sec. If an application is not responding within 5 sec, ANR will occur

rootnode.question: How to stop the services in android?
rootnode.hint: We can stop the services by stopSelf() and stopService(), in some cases android will kill the services due to the low memory problem.

rootnode.question: Which permissions are required to get a location in android?
rootnode.hint:
The main permissions you need are android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or 
android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION.

rootnode.question: Is it possible to have an activity without UI in android?
rootnode.option3: It will give run time error

rootnode.question: Assets Holds
rootnode.hint: Assets provide a way to include arbitrary files like text, xml, fonts, music, and video in your application. If you try to include these files as "resources", Android will process them into its resource system and you will not be able to get the raw data. If you want to access data untouched, Assets are one way to do it.

rootnode.question: What is meant by AAPT?
rootnode.hint: Android Application Packaging Tool is a default tool of android sdk to pack all classes and resources to apk file

rootnode.question: What is DDMS in Android?
rootnode.hint: Android Studio includes a debugging tool called the Dalvik Debug Monitor Server (DDMS),which provides port-forwarding services, screen capture on the device, thread and heap information on the device, logcat, process, and radio state information, incoming call and SMS spoofing, location data spoofing, and more

rootnode.question: Which Database is Automatically supplied to you in Android?
rootnode.hint:
SQLite is a opensource SQL database that stores data to a text file on a device. Android comes in with built in SQLite database implementation.
SQLite supports all the relational database features. In order to access this database, you don't need to establish any kind of connections for it.

rootnode.question: Which Exception is thrown when a given package name ,application or component name cannot be found?
rootnode.hint:
PackageManager.NameNotFoundException exception is thrown when a given package, application, or component name cannot be found.
Resources.NotFoundException exception is thrown by the resource APIs when a requested resource can not be found.

rootnode.question: The root element of AndroidManifest.xml file is
rootnode.hint: manifest is the root element of the AndroidManifest.xml file. It has package attribute that describes the package name of the activity class.

rootnode.question: Who designed Android Logo?
rootnode.hint: Android logo was designed by Irina Blok and is said to be insipired from an old Atari video game called “Gauntlet: The Third Encounter”

rootnode.question: What is the time limit of broadcast receiver in Android?
rootnode.hint: Broad cast Receiver is a component that responds to system wide broad cast announcements. It acts as gateway to other components of our application. It is not supposed to do long running operation, it has to do its operation in 10 seconds maximum.

rootnode.question: Which field accepts only digits?
rootnode.hint: android:digits specifies that the particular textview has a numeric input method

rootnode.question: Android Logo is inspired from :-
rootnode.hint: Android logo was designed by Irina Blok and is said to be inspired from an old Atari video game called “Gauntlet: The Third Encounter”

rootnode.question: Who was not among the founders of Android?
rootnode.hint: Android, Inc. was founded in Palo Alto, California in October 2003 by Andy Rubin ,Rich Miner ,Nick Sears.

rootnode.question: All layout classes are direct subclasses of:-
rootnode.hint: A Viewgroup is a special view that contains other views (called children).The view group is a base class for layouts and views.

rootnode.question: How to kill an Activity in Android?
rootnode.hint:
Calling finish() in onCreate(): onCreate() -> onDestroy()
Calling finish() in onStart() : onCreate() -> onStart() -> onStop() -> onDestroy()
Calling finish() in onResume(): onCreate() -> onStart() -> onResume() -> onPause() -> onStop() -> onDestroy()

rootnode.question: The first smart phone to run on Android platform was:-
For writing Android code using C/C++ you need to use ________
rootnode.hint: The android NDK is a toolset that lets you implement parts of your app using native-code languages such as C and C++

rootnode.question: On which Thread Services work in Android?
rootnode.hint: Android Services are long running Background process running on Main i.e UI thread.

rootnode.question: What is ADB in Android?
rootnode.hint: ADB,Android Debug Bridge , is a command-line utility included with Google's Android SDK.ADB can control your device our USB from a computer,copy files back and forth,install and uninstall apps, run shell commands etc.

rootnode.question: What is AIDL in Android?
rootnode.hint: AIDL, or Android Interface Definition Language, handles the interface requirements between a client and a service so both can communicate at the same level through interprocess communication or IPC. This process involves breaking down objects into primitives that Android can understand. This part is required simply because a process cannot access the memory of the other process.

rootnode.question: What does APK stands for?
rootnode.hint: APK is an android packaging kit. We can pack/zip, our code in apk format to work on Android devices as an application.

rootnode.question: What is GCM in Android?
rootnode.hint: GCM stands for Google Cloud Messaging using which we can push the data from the servers to client devices. In short, we can send messages to mobile devices through the cloud(Push Notification).

rootnode.question: Is it mandatory to call onCreate() in android?
rootnode.hint: onCreate() is NOT required for apps. But, the reason it is common to every single app is because that method is typically the best place to put initialization code. We can also put that same exact initialization code in onStart() or onResume() method.

rootnode.question: How to get a response from an activity in Android?
rootnode.hint: startActivityForResult(Intent intent,int requestCode) will give the response from second activity to first activity as a result.

rootnode.question: What is singleton class in android?
rootnode.option1: A class that can create only one object
rootnode.hint: In object-oriented programming , a singleton class is a class that can have only one object (an instance of the class) at a time.
rootnode.ans: A class that can create only one object

rootnode.question: On which thread services work in android?
rootnode.hint: Service is a long running background process running in the Main Thread

rootnode.question: What built in database is Android shipped with ?
rootnode.hint: SQLite is a opensource SQL database that stores data to a text file on a device. Android comes in with built in SQLite database implementation.SQLite supports all the relational database features

rootnode.question: _________ sets the gravity of the content of the View its used on.
rootnode.hint: android:gravity sets the gravity of the content of the View its used on. It describes how the content should be aligned with respect to the View.

rootnode.question: _________ sets the gravity of the View or Layout in its parent.
rootnode.hint: android:layout_gravity sets the gravity of the content of the View its used on. It describes how the view should be aligned with respect to the Parent.

rootnode.question: _________ is a view group that aligns all children in a single direction, vertically or horizontally
rootnode.hint: LinearLayout is a view group that aligns all children in a single direction, vertically or horizontally.All children of a LinearLayout are stacked one after the other, so a vertical list will only have one child per row, no matter how wide they are, and a horizontal list will only be one row high (the height of the tallest child, plus padding).

rootnode.question: _________ is a view group that aligns all children in a single direction, vertically or horizontally
rootnode.hint: LinearLayout is a view group that aligns all children in a single direction, vertically or horizontally.All children of a LinearLayout are stacked one after the other, so a vertical list will only have one child per row, no matter how wide they are, and a horizontal list will only be one row high (the height of the tallest child, plus padding).

rootnode.question: In LinearLayout to arrange layout horizontally we use attribue:-
rootnode.hint: In LinearLayout to arrange children either horizontally or vertically we use attribute android:orientation="horizontal".

rootnode.question: ______ Layout organises content into rows and columns
rootnode.hint: TableLayout organises content into rows and columns.We use <TableRow> element to build a row in the table. Each row has zero or more cells; each cell can hold one View object.

rootnode.question: ______ is the simplest data storing option available in Android.It stores data in key value pairs.
rootnode.hint:
SharedPreference is the simplest data storing option available in Android.It stores data in key value pairs.

Data is stored in XML file in the directory data/data/<package-name>/shared-prefs folder

rootnode.question: To send SMS we need to declare which permission in AndroidManifest.xml file?
rootnode.hint:
To send SMS declare:

<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.SEND_SMS"/>

rootnode.question: ______ is a view that display web pages inside your application
rootnode.hint: WebView is a view that display web pages inside your application.WebView makes turns your application to a web application.
